author: Hannah

text:
hey, Outbreak was good.

so long as you let the AI do it's own thing and progress normally, the only hiccups in gameplay you'll face are item management and getting people to hand the puzzle pieces they picked up to you.

The partner AI adds a little randomness and hectic action to the gameplay and each run through each scenario will be a little different because of it.

text:
Heya, SupraDarky! I'm just your everyday long-term follower! Thank you for continuously introducing us to new and old VG hits!

If you haven't heard it already, I have a recommendation for you - it's a song called "Maplecrest," from the recent videogame fighter, "Skull Girls!" Based on what you showed me so far, there's a good chance you'd like it~

author: The Pinch

text:
Just giving a heads up Capcom has said due to sales of Survival horror games vs shooters, RE6 will be more similar to RE5 and taking the action approach.
Of course RE4 was more action based than the 1st 3, and that still maintained atmosphere and a few scares so hope exists.
Though Capcom of modern era, again, just giving you a heads up, not saying you shouldn't look forward to it, but I wouldn't expect RE4's quality.
author: Arc13

text: I gave up when I couldn't even move in the room with the giant fleas or kill them. It just seemed as though it was entirely MADE for multiplayer. Is it really as impossible as I remember?

author: DTMTroy

text:
I always love outbreak for its single player, how it essentially distilled the resident evil formula into five REALLY cool scenarios.

it wasn't until recently it occurred to me why people hated it: shitty online. ah well. I still think its a fun game.
author: Jessica Carroll

text: Resident Evil never really was too strong in the music department in my opinion. The fact that it has to be in a horror environment means that it really can't go much beyond creepy sounding music. Still love the games though :D. This theme is pretty good, despite that.

text: Always been of this theme even though I never had to pleasure of playing outbreak. Anybody reccomend it?
author: DuarteGlen

text: After Silent Hill, time for some Resident Evil. This might be one of my favorite themes from the franchise. I didn't play the Outbreak games though. Hopefully Resident Evil 6 is good, eventhough I completed RE5 I never really got into it like I did with RE4. More atmosphere and horror Capcom! That's what I loved about this franchise.
